greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: for 0 <= k < n, a(n, k) is the sum of the products of all subsets of {n-k, n-k+1, ..., n} with k members.
comment: Triangle A165674, which is the reversal of this triangle, is generated by the asymptotic expansion of the higher order exponential integral E(x,m=2,n). - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Oct 16 2009
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
formula: a(n, k) = A067176(n, n-k-1) = A105954(k+1, n-k). Row sums are given by A093344.
mathematica: T[n_, 0] := 1; T[n_, k_]:= Product[i, {i, n - k, n}]*Sum[1/i, {i, n - k, n}]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 0, n - 1}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 21 2017 *)
program: tabl(nn) = for (n=1, nn, for (k=0, n-1, print1(a(n,k), ", ")); print()); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 21 2017
xref: The leading diagonal is given by A000254, Stirling numbers of first kind. The next nine diagonals are A001705, A001711, A001716, A001721, A051524, A051545, A051560, A051562 and A051564, generalized Stirling numbers.
A165674 is the reversal of this triangle. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Oct 16 2009
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 24 2004
ext: Edited and extended by _David Wasserman_, Apr 24 2007
